title: Gower Family Beach Adventure
tagline: Rock pools, beaches, and gentle thrills
suitableFor: Families with children aged 8+ who enjoy gentle outdoor activities and exploring beaches.  Kids must be comfortable in the water.
notSuitableFor: Those seeking extreme adventure or with very young children (under 5) who cannot participate in all activities.

stops.title: Surfing Lesson at Llangennith Beach
stops.description: Learn the basics of surfing with a qualified instructor on the wide, sandy beach at Llangennith. Suitable for complete beginners.

wetAlt.title: Gower Heritage Centre
wetAlt.description: Explore craft workshops, a vintage railway, and a soft play area - great for kids on a rainy day.

budgetAlt.title: Bodyboarding at Llangennith Beach
budgetAlt.description: Rent a bodyboard and have fun riding the waves on your own.

stops.title: The King's Head, Llangennith
stops.description: A traditional pub serving classic pub fare with a family-friendly atmosphere.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Llangennith dunes
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own sandwiches with amazing beach views

stops.title: Rock Pooling at Rhossili Bay
stops.description: Explore the rock pools at low tide, searching for crabs, starfish, and other marine life. Check tide times before you go!
stops.travelToNext: 30 min drive via B4247 and A4118

wetAlt.title: National Trust Shop and Cafe, Rhossili
wetAlt.description: Browse local gifts and enjoy a hot chocolate while watching the rain over Rhossili Bay.

budgetAlt.title: Worm's Head Walk (weather permitting)
budgetAlt.description: Check tide times for a walk to the spectacular Worm's Head. Free, but only accessible at low tide.

stops.title: Rhosili Bunkhouse
stops.description: A comfortable and affordable bunkhouse in the heart of Rhossili village, ideal for families on a budget.

budgetAlt.title: Pitton Cross Campsite
budgetAlt.description: A well-maintained campsite with stunning views across Rhossili Bay.

stops.title: Walk to Three Cliffs Bay
stops.description: Hike along the coastal path from Pennard Cliffs to the iconic Three Cliffs Bay, enjoying breathtaking views.

wetAlt.title: Swansea Museum
wetAlt.description: Delve into the history of Swansea and the Gower Peninsula at this fascinating museum.

budgetAlt.title: Explore Pennard Castle Ruins
budgetAlt.description: Discover the atmospheric ruins of Pennard Castle, perched on a clifftop overlooking Three Cliffs Bay.

stops.title: Three Cliffs Coffee Shop
stops.description: Enjoy a light lunch or snack at this cafe near Three Cliffs Bay, known for its delicious cakes.

budgetAlt.title: Picnic on Three Cliffs Bay
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own food with incredible beach views

stops.title: Relax and Play on Three Cliffs Bay
stops.description: Spend the afternoon swimming, building sandcastles, and enjoying the beautiful scenery of Three Cliffs Bay.

wetAlt.title: LC Swansea
wetAlt.description: A huge indoor waterpark, complete with slides, wave pool and climbing walls

budgetAlt.title: Building sandcastles
budgetAlt.description: Free fun on one of the most beautiful beaches in the UK

stops.title: Three Cliffs Bay Campsite
stops.description: A family-friendly campsite with stunning views of Three Cliffs Bay.  Book well in advance.

budgetAlt.title: Wild Camping near Pennard Cliffs (permit required)
budgetAlt.description: A unique camping experience with incredible views.  Obtain necessary permits beforehand.

stops.title: Stand-Up Paddleboarding at Oxwich Bay
stops.description: Enjoy a guided stand-up paddleboarding session in the calm waters of Oxwich Bay. Suitable for all skill levels.

wetAlt.title: National Waterfront Museum, Swansea
wetAlt.description: Explore the industrial and maritime history of Wales at this interactive museum.

budgetAlt.title: Swimming at Oxwich Bay
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a free swim in the safe, shallow waters of Oxwich Bay.

stops.title: Oxwich Bay Hotel Restaurant
stops.description: A seaside restaurant with panoramic views of Oxwich Bay, offering a menu of fresh seafood and local produce.

budgetAlt.title: Picnic at Oxwich Point
budgetAlt.description: Find a quiet spot on Oxwich Point and enjoy a picnic lunch with stunning views.

stops.title: Coastal Walk to Port Eynon
stops.description: Take a scenic walk along the coastal path from Oxwich Bay to Port Eynon, enjoying the dramatic cliffs and sandy coves.

wetAlt.title: Plantasia Tropical Zoo
wetAlt.description: An indoor tropical zoo with exotic plants and animals. It can be found in Swansea.

budgetAlt.title: Relax on Oxwich Bay
budgetAlt.description: Spend the afternoon sunbathing, swimming, and relaxing on the beach.

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Gower weather can be unpredictable, even in summer. Pack layers and be prepared for rain. Sea temperatures are chilly, even in August.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy on the A4118, especially during peak season. Parking at popular beaches fills up quickly - arrive early or use public transport.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Surfing lessons and accommodation should be booked well in advance, particularly during school holidays. Three Cliffs Bay campsite is VERY popular.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: This trip is suitable for those with a basic level of fitness. The coastal walks involve some moderate inclines and uneven terrain.
